select1.label: Explain the procedure to the family and to the child. Arrange all the articles -Sterile tray -Sterile lumbar puncture set – articles to be listed -Sterile gloves , gown and mask -Sterile dressing towels with slit -Sterile cotton swabs , guaze pieces, cotton pads -Lumbar puncture needles 2 sizes with stillette -5 ml syringe , with needles to give local anesthesia -Sponge holding forceps -Small bowel to take antiseptic solution -Specimen bottles Clean tray containing -Adhesive plasters and scissors -Mackintosh and towel kidney tray and paper bag -Lignocaine -Skin antiseptics and sterile normal saline

Position the child Recumbent position Restrain the patient by directing one arm under the flexed knees and grasping the child's wrists. This restrains both the upper and lower extremities. The other arm is placed posteriorly around the patients neck and shoulders. Sitting position The child may sit voluntarily on the table with elbows resting on the knees and back arched. A pillow can be placed in front of the chest and the child instructed to grasp it. The nurse must hold the infant in a sitting position. By flexing the thighs on the abdomen the nurse is able to grasp the elbow and knees in both hands thus flexing the spine in the appropriate angle. Assist the doctor as required – The doctor will proceed as follows
Prepare the skin with antiseptic solution
Drapes the back and identify puncture site.
Infiltrates the areas with local anesthetic agents
Insert the needle and stillet firmly into the sub arachnoid space
When the samples are collected and measurement completed the needle is withdrawn
Apply pressure ,over the lumbar puncture site using a sterile topical swab.
Dorsal recumbent position of 8 to 24 hrs
Record the procedure with time, date, appearance of the spinal fluid ,condition of child, label and send to the lab
When the leakage from the puncture site has ceased , apply a plaster dressing over the site.
Observe patient for next 24 hrs -Leakage of CSF -Headache ,backache -Neurological observations -Vital signs
